references.paper_title: Stream of Search (SoS): Learning to search in language.
references.reason: This paper introduces the Stream of Search (SoS) method, which is directly compared to and contrasted with the proposed Self-Backtracking method throughout the paper, making it a crucial benchmark and highly relevant to the core methodology.

references.paper_title: Direct preference optimization: Your language model is secretly a reward model.
references.reason: This paper proposes the DPO method which is used as a baseline and comparative method to evaluate the effectiveness and performance of the proposed Self-Backtracking approach.

references.paper_title: Guided stream of search: Learning to better search with language models via optimal path guidance.
references.reason: This paper is used as a comparative and competitive baseline method to assess the performance of the proposed Self-Backtracking method, offering insights into alternative approaches for improving language model reasoning.

references.paper_title: Learning to reason with large language models
references.reason: This paper introduces OpenAI's work on reasoning with LLMs, which serves as the foundation and context for the proposed Self-Backtracking method. The paper's models and findings are repeatedly referenced throughout the study.

references.paper_title: Chain of thought imitation with procedure cloning.
references.reason: This paper explores chain-of-thought prompting, providing a crucial theoretical and comparative baseline for the self-backtracking approach. It forms a key component in the conceptual framework of the paper.
